statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

article.description: Appalachian State pulls away from Bluefield 97-70
article.headline: Appalachian State pulls away from Bluefield 97-70
article.linkText: Appalachian State pulls away from Bluefield 97-70
article.story: BOONE, N.C. -- Mike Neal scored 23 points and Michael Obacha had 11 points and 12 rebounds as Appalachian State pulled away from NAIA Bluefield 97-70 on Monday. Neal hit 8 of 9 shots, including 4 of 5 3-pointers as the Mountaineers (4-8) hit 10 of 20 from behind the arch en route to shooting 63.2 percent from the field. Tab Hamilton added 16 points and Chris Burgess had 14. Nequan Melvin came off the bench to lead Bluefield with 13 points. Devin Page had 12 and Kearsten Marion 10. Bluefield hung tough in the first half, getting the last four points to trail 53-41. But Hamilton hit a 3 and then made two free throws and the lead was 20 with 10:43 left in the game. The Rams shot just 40 percent and only made 9 of 16 free throws.
